alert.note: Alert for North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 21 at 10:20PM MDT until June 21 at 11:45PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: .Heavy rainfall is possible with widespread convection this afternoon, through this evening, into tonight; soils are likely already saturated in many areas and excessive runoff is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Washington and Lincoln Counties, and Elbert County below 6000 feet. (Portions of east central and northeast Colorado, including the following areas, in east central Colorado, North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet/North Lincoln County and Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet/South Lincoln County. In northeast Colorado, Washington County.) * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall on already saturated soils may cause excessive runoff and flooding across the warning area.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County; Washington County
